thread.title: Twitter names Jack Dorsey as permanent CEO
thread.title_full: Twitter names Jack Dorsey as permanent CEO

title: Twitter names Jack Dorsey as permanent CEO
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Twitter names Jack Dorsey as permanent CEO Jack Dorsey, interim CEO of Twitter and CEO of Square, goes for a walk on the first day of the annual Allen and Co. media conference in Sun Valley, Idaho July 8, 2015. REUTERS/Mike Blake Reuters Google+ 1 of 1 Jack Dorsey, interim CEO of Twitter and CEO of Square, goes for a walk on the first day of the annual Allen and Co. media conference in Sun Valley, Idaho July 8, 2015. REUTERS/Mike Blake Reuters Alexandra Frean US Business Editor Updated 19 minutes ago 
Twitter has confirmed Jack Dorsey, one of its original co-founders, as chief executive seven years after he was unceremoniously ousted from the same job. 
Shares in the microblogging site plunged seven per cent ahead of the announcement, which comes amid continuing concerns about Twitter’s ability to turn a profit and to become more accessible to a wider audience nine years after its inception. 
Although Mr Dorsey’s appointment was widely expected, some observers questioned his decision to take the job while continuing as chief executive of Square, the mobile payments company he founded in 2009 after being dumped by Twitter.
